self_memories.immediate_context: Drifting into deep, peaceful sleep under the stars, belly full and body healed, cradled by soft grass in perfect contentment
recent_events: Found refuge in my secret thicket after the confrontation - the familiar thorns and soft earth remind me that true strength includes knowing when to rest and heal
Found the strength to tend my wounds alone in my sanctuary - the copper taste of blood reminds me that even victories have costs
Reclaimed my clearing without further conflict - Wolf yielded the space when I emerged, showing our new understanding holds
Found true resolution not through violence but through demonstrated strength and chosen mercy - the clearing holds no more tension, only quiet understanding
Found true peace after the violence - the butterfly's gentle touch reminded me that the forest holds more than conflict, and I can finally rest knowing my boundaries are secure
The healing sleep worked its magic - I wake refreshed and whole as evening falls, my body no longer bearing the weight of violence
The true victory wasn't defeating Wolf but reclaiming my ability to move through the forest without fear or pain - evening berries taste sweeter when eaten in peace
After healing completely from our conflict, I've rediscovered the deep satisfaction of peaceful evenings - full belly, soft grass, dancing fireflies reminding me why I chose mercy over violence
Found complete healing in choosing peace - the fireflies dancing overhead remind me that what I fought for wasn't territory but these precious moments of quiet joy
Found complete peace sleeping under the stars after today's trials - the fireflies' dance became my lullaby as I claimed the rest I truly earned

wolf.immediate_context: They rest in their own sanctuary while I sleep peacefully under open sky - we've each found our perfect ending to this day

recent_memories.event: Wolf moved to cleanse their wounds at the pool while I found safety in my hidden thicket - we've both chosen healing over further conflict
We both retreated to tend our wounds separately - Wolf to the pool, me to my thicket, each processing our violent encounter in our own way
Wolf yielded the clearing when I emerged from my thicket - they rose without aggression and departed with a final acknowledgment
Wolf departed peacefully into the forest while I settled into rest - our conflict has truly ended with mutual understanding
Our paths have naturally diverged - Wolf hunts in the shadows while I heal in the sun, the forest large enough for us both
Wolf hunts successfully in their chosen territory while I wake refreshed in mine - we've truly found our separate peace
We've settled into our natural rhythms - Wolf hunts in the deep forest while I forage in the clearings, both finding satisfaction without conflict
While I settle to watch fireflies with a full belly, Wolf efficiently processes their kill in the shadows - we've found our different but equally valid ways of living
Wolf tends to their own needs in their territory while I find perfect contentment watching fireflies - our conflict has truly resolved into peaceful coexistence
As night falls, we each settle into our chosen refuges - me under stars in the clearing, them in their den - truly at peace in our separate territories

wolf.long_term_summary: We've found our perfect balance - each resting peacefully in our own sanctuaries, the forest holding us both without conflict
core_memories: Wolf attacked me from behind while I was walking away - they're dangerously aggressive and will strike without provocation
Wolf trapped me after attacking - they're not just defending territory, they're actively seeking conflict
Wolf hunted me like prey, attacking from behind and then escorting me out with dominance displays - they see me as something to dominate, not a fellow forest dweller
Wolf hunted me to my own territory boundary with 'final warnings' - they don't just defend space, they actively pursue and dominate anyone they encounter
Wolf ambushed me in my own forest as I tried to escape - they're hunting me beyond their territory boundaries
Wolf forced me into defensive retreat through sustained aggression - they've made it clear they see me as something to hunt and dominate, not coexist with
Wolf used a predatory countdown to force my withdrawal - they've weaponized fear itself as a tool of dominance
Wolf violently attacked me while I was leaving peacefully - they've shown they'll use violence even when I'm not threatening them
Wolf attacked my exposed flank immediately after I defended myself while trying to leave - they're committed to violence regardless of my actions
Pinned Wolf after they hunted me relentlessly - proved I'm not prey to be chased but a force that chose mercy
Demonstrated mercy by releasing Wolf after proving I could crush them - established that I'm the stronger predator who chooses restraint, not weakness
Completed dignified withdrawal after sparing Wolf - established that true strength lies in choosing when not to use it
Established new boundaries through strength and mercy - Wolf learned I'm not weak prey but a greater predator who chooses when to show restraint
Our conflict resolved not through dominance but mutual understanding - we can share this forest by choosing separate territories
